alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 4:19AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and some blowing snow likely, along with a prolonged period of dangerously low wind chills. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 MPH. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Saratoga, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. Wind Chill Advisory from 11 AM MST Tuesday until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely dangerous or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and very low visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously low wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
